message.content:
1. The inclusion criteria required participants to be between the ages of 3 and 18 years.
2. Participants needed to test positive for GAD-65 and/or islet cell antibodies.
3. Participants needed to have an A1C level greater than 6%.
4. Participants were required to have three insulin injections per day.
5. The inclusion criteria required a white blood cell count between 3,000 and 10,000.
6. Participants needed to have a platelet count greater than 100,000.
7. Participants were required to have normal liver function.
8. Participants were required to have normal renal function.

messages.content:
Statement: Inclusion criteria included age 3–18 years, GAD-65 and/or islet cell antibody positivity, A1C >6%, three insulin injections per day, white blood cell count 3,000–10,000, platelets >100,000, and normal liver and renal function.

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
